import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Layout, Navigation, Content } from 'react-mdl'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import UWeekendHack from './images/UWeekendHack.jpg'; import UWeekendAll from './images/UWeekendAll.jpg'; import UWeekendWin from './images/UWeekendWin.jpg'; import TechAdidas1 from './images/TechAdidas1.png'; import TechAdidas2 from './images/TechAdidas2.png'; class Resume extends Component { render() { return(

Ucode Weekend

(May 2017. Madrid, Spain.)

"A 48-hours hackathon to develop an IoT solution using and IBM cloud (Watson), to bring new user experience for banks or insurance companies."

Capgemini wants to use the latest technology from IBM to bring service or technology for their clients, like banks or insurance companies. The 36-hours Ucode hackathon by Capgemini aimed to engage people from the company and student to participate in the development of innovative service experience using digital solutions. The challenge was to develop a functional digital solution for Capgemini clients that uses IBM cloud and IoT technology: Beacons, Bluetooth, Raspberry Pi, NFC ...

NED-team, a four students team from the Polytechnic University of Madrid participated together in the event and we won the challenge “2º place”, we formed a balanced team with computer science backgrounds, experiencing their 1º hackathon.

The problem

As a first step, we needed to define a problem to solve with our application. As time was limited to 36 hours, we had to move quickly and brainstormed problem statements and find the best solution to implement it.

We focused our design and development towards solving the challenge of bringing a new service for banks. After a search on the topic and making some interviews, we end up finding two main problems. The first problems banks deal is related to queueing and making appointments in the bank. The second problem the banks face is related to the way people make money from their ATMs. The goal of the team was to use beacons and Watson to bring new software that solves the identified problems and bank and costumers get advantages.

The solution

The solution we aimed to hack together was a web application called “QueueMi” that manages an appointment in banks and automatization the process of taking money from the ATM. To implement this final solution we made use of React Native, Android studio, IBM cloud, Firebase and Python for the software, and NFC, Bluetooth, Estimote and RaspberryPi as the IoT network.

The result within 36 hours was "QueueMi", a web app that changes the way user experience when they go to their banks, making more easy and intuitive to interact with the employees and control all their data.

My learning

The Ucode by Capgemini was my first real two “overnight” Hackathon. We learned that it is important to participate in a diverse team of developers and designers and also keep business aspects in mind. As a team, we worked according to our skills and took some time to plan the features and user journey before starting the actual “hacking”. My main role in the team was to manage the team organization, develop the idea, design the interface, develop the front-end and be the responsible to do the pitch. This also helped us come up with a better, more thought-through solution in the end. Our effort was recognised: "QueueMi" won the second prize for the IoT category.

Last but not least, I learned how important it is to believe in oneself as a team and keep going even if success seems far away. It may seem difficult to continue after 2 night of none stop coding – but every team is going through the same struggle and in the end, the extra effort will be worth it.
